alert.note: Alert for Amelia; Charles City; Chesterfield; City of Colonial Heights; City of Hopewell; City of Petersburg; Dinwiddie; Henrico; Powhatan; Prince George (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 23 at 7:37PM EDT until September 23 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR AMELIA, CHESTERFIELD, SOUTHEASTERN HENRICO, SOUTHWESTERN POWHATAN, SOUTHWESTERN CHARLES CITY, NORTHERN DINWIDDIE AND PRINCE GEORGE COUNTIES AND THE CITY OF COLONIAL HEIGHTS, THE CITY OF HOPEWELL AND THE CITY OF PETERSBURG... At 737 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Petersburg, Dinwiddie, Hopewell, Colonial Heights, Charles City, Claremont, Virginia State University, Chester, Fort Gregg-Adams, Moseley, Mannboro, Disputanta, Amelia Courthouse, Prince George, Sutherland, Matoaca, Chesterfield Court House, Ettrick, Bellwood and Bensley. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

area.areaDesc: Amelia; Charles City; Chesterfield; City of Colonial Heights; City of Hopewell; City of Petersburg; Dinwiddie; Henrico; Powhatan; Prince George
